meanings.definition: The disturbance of sedimentary deposits by living organisms.
meanings.sent1: The bioturbations in the soil were caused by worms moving through it.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study bioturbations to understand how organisms affect sediment layers.
meanings.sent3: The bioturbations in the garden made it look like a tiny earthquake had hit.
meanings.sent4: The bioturbations of the ants created intricate patterns in the sand.
meanings.sent5: The bioturbations of the fish stirred up the ocean floor, revealing hidden treasures.

meanings.definition: The mixing of soil or sediment layers by biological activity.
meanings.sent1: The farmer observed bioturbations in the field caused by earthworms.
meanings.sent2: Bioturbations play a crucial role in nutrient cycling in ecosystems.
meanings.sent3: The bioturbations in the garden made it easier for plants to grow.
meanings.sent4: The bioturbations of the roots helped aerate the soil for better plant growth.
meanings.sent5: The bioturbations of the insects created a healthier environment for the plants.
